CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. 8 reads: "Rival Candidates - The most enlightening and entertaining feature of the NAACP Human Rights Dinner at the Penn-Sheraton Hotel, last Friday night, was the appearance of Gov. George M. Leader, Democrat, and Congressman Hugh Scott, Republican, rival candidates for the U.S. Senate. Governor Leader cited his appointment of a Negro to a cabinet post and Negroes in other positions in the state government, also his speedy action in Levittown after a Negro family had been threatened by race-haters.  Congressman Scott pointed to his record of 16 years in Congress as a supporter of legislation to protect and help Negroes.  W. Beverly Carter Jr., Courier publisher, introduced Congressman Scott, and James A. Jordon introduced Governor Leader... In the right picture are Mr. Jordon, Governor Leader, Congressman Scott (standing) and Mayor David L. Lawrence. -Harris Photos"
TitMainTitle: James A. Jordon, Governor George M. Leader, Congressman Hugh Scott, and Mayor David L. Lawrence, gathered around table in Penn Sheraton hotel for NAACP Human Rights Dinner, with Marion Bond Jordon partially visible on right
